reviews.text: I tried to give it a chance because I usually eat Outback and thought itâ€™d be similar. Really mid. Outlaw was salty. The butter was not soft enough to spread on the bread comfortably and the Caesar salad tasted like the prepared types in the grocery store. Outback supersedes Longhorn by miles.

You must try this restaurant.Go find Medina,she will let you get vvip service.She is so nice and kind.The food is best,so juicy and delicious. Thank you Medina!

Amazing service , Jasmin superstar !! Just landed back to NYC. Wow.
The staff was especially nice.
Attended a most lucrative luncheon there!! Service was absolutely spectacular!  Thanks, guys! â¤ï¸

Is always great at Longhorn.  Cowboy Pork Chops perfectly cooked, sweet potato with cinamon and sugar a must have. Spicy chicken bites on point. Molten Chocalate cake a super dessert .Service always great!!
My favorite econo steak spot!
Food was great, the young lady that took my order was very nice. Even though the food took a long time to come out it was delicious.
Love the place. Not that expensive at all. Extremely good food!!!!

ìŠ¤í…Œì´í¬ëŠ” ì•ˆì‹¬ì´ ê°€ì¥ ë§›ìˆê³  ì¢‹ì•˜ì§€ë§Œ ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ë©´ì—ì„œëŠ” ë§ì´ ë–¨ì–´ì ¸ìš”. ê°œì¸ìš© ì ‘ì‹œë„ ì•ˆì£¼ê³ , ë¬¼ë„ ì•ˆì£¼ê³ , ìŒì‹ì€ ë„ˆë¬´ë‚˜ ëŠ¦ê²Œ ë‚˜ì™€ì„œ ì†ë‹˜ë“¤ì´ ë‹¤ë“¤ ì§€ì³ìš”. ì§€ì³ì„œ ë§ì´ ëª»ë¨¹ëŠ” ê²ƒ ê°™ì•„ìš”. ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ëŠ” ì¢‹ì•„ìš”.
Flo's Fillet w/lobster tail (very small tail) with mac n cheese & corn on the cob. Delish!

I love this place and trust me when I say. Have the longhorn steak absolutely  delicious.  My favorite  thing from there plus the grilled corn.  The waitress and staff are always attentive and nice.. highly recommend  this place

Badly managed. I arrived at 8:55 and was told the wait time is 30 mins. Within the next hour I patiently waited and seeing many people who did not have reservation just like me got seated. And the hostess finally offered me one table at 9:46 when they were closing and this table was right next to the toilet. Meanwhile, there were more than 10 available table. Why the hostess did this to me has reasons beyond my understanding! I had to leave as I cannot spend any more time, all this non sense waiting has already delayed my evening activities.
The place was so nice and the waiter was so kind, her name was Thereza and she was so polite and she kept the communication going. I loved that placed and I think she should definitely get a raise!
The food makes up for the service

First time at this restaurant.  I was pleasantly  surprised i thought this was like a fast food joint. Teresa was our sweet, bubbly & perfect server. The food was great. I ordered the Rib Eye. The Sirloin & the crispy shrimp & Texonions.
I wanted to like it, but not enough workers waited so long for service and the check, and all that would have been okay if the food was good, but that was the worst part of the whole night.
the chicken in my dish was raw, waiter didnt care and did nothing about it. horrible establishment, roaches in the bathroom, pee on the floor
The worst restaurant I ever been
Everything was great. Food was great. Drinks were great atmosphere was beautiful. My only issue was the parking. It is Queens Boulevard.ğŸ¤·ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸
Everything looked freshly prepared.
I enjoy how the staff take the time to check if everything is to your liking.

My first longhorn experience was amazing although it was in Westchester a long ways from where I lived the experience was wonderful. The food was great. The service was great. However, the Queenâ€™s location was a different experience altogether. The greeters at the door werenâ€™t attentive. I order as an appetizer, the stuffed mushrooms and entrÃ©e the Longhorn ribeye  with bone, the corn and brussels sprouts. The food was too salty, Especially the corn and the mushrooms. My steak was overcooked. I asked for medium steak and received well done. If that wasnâ€™t bad enough, the manager tried to argue me down and said, you asked for medium well. To make matters worse they didnâ€™t even have a glass for my drink.  They gave me a margarita, mixer, and a shot glass. Never again!  And the bathroom was disgusting!
The atmosphere in the evening is romantic with the soft lighting.

September 17, 2025 @242pm. The girl at the bar was not nice, she was yelling at me from the register in spanish without even handing me the menu, then she gave me the menu n dissappear for a while, she acted sort of bias,  the guy next toâ€¦

I only tried this place because I was given a gift card. I was pleasantly surprised, it was really good. I ordered the Outlaw 20ounce Ribeye,loaded baked potato and salad. On the website, they have a option to join the wait list, so when we arrived at 630pm on a Saturday night, no wait whatsoever, right to a booth table. The service was great, took drink order, brought us a warmed bread with butter, and a huge Salad, both delicious. If you're prior Military like me, ask them for your 10% off discount. Our Steaks did not disappoint, cooked perfectly. Overall, we enjoyed our meal ğŸ˜‹. They have a parking lot, but the earlier you go the better for getting a spot. It's a congested area, because they're multiple other restaurants nearby. Definitely would go again.

Waited over an hour for just appetizers the only thing my family was going to eat, very bad service, the waitress didn't even communicate to let my family know that our food was going to be delayed and whilst we were deciding to just leave she comes and says "oh your food is right here"  needless to say we left because we was hungry and did not appreciate the service.
Very bad service. I went to dinner with my family and the service was terrible. An hour passed and the food hadn't arrived. I had to leave because my family was already hungry.
Very pleasant staff and the food was fresh and tasty
foods always great! service is always wonderful as well.
Me and wife's favorite place to eat steak.great service, clean place, we love it.food is always on point.

The food was so disappointing and service. The strawberry lemonade was nasty, the salmon was nasty, the bread was hard, the rice was nasty, the steak was nasty, the Mac and cheese was nasty, the chicken tenders was nasty, this place is just nasty. Smh the only thing I enjoyed was the corn and Cesar salad. Food was just plainâ€¦ Delicious corn though. I swear this is why I donâ€™t go to places that have lower than a 4.5 rating, my friend wanted to go so bad because she liked â€œlong hornâ€ in the southâ€¦ Mind you 9/10 food in the south tastes better than food in NY. Even the waiter kept disappearing, had to keep asking other waiters. I swear just a waste of time going there. Hopefully they improve, but itâ€™s a never again for me. Donâ€™t make the same mistake as me!!!!!
Menu was good the salad i picked was really tasty, my sister order the ribs and they were amazing, they melted in your mouth, and the bill was not crazy at all
Steak and lobster were PERFECT!
Great local steakhouse, awesome staff and good pricing. TV at the bar with drink specials all day.
When we order our steak  it came  burn, we ask for the manager and she help us to get more steak, other wise the place was nice and clean  and friendly  service with a ğŸ˜ƒâ€¦

Iâ€™m very disappointed in food and service on Aug 23rd 2025 . I ordered a ribeye steak, mashed potatoes and asparagus and all of the food had no flavor asparagus was still raw. I requested for an additional garlic butter to try to help the flavor, but it still did not taste good. My best friend had a cheeseburger with fries that did not have enough flavor.  Iâ€™m not sure if they have a change in cook, but whoever made the food yesterday it did not taste good they need to go back to culinary school. I always go to this restaurant with my family and never have a problem but yesterday food was horrible and the service that we received wasnâ€™t too great either possibly that the young lady was tired or she had too many tables to look out for that could be a bit overwhelming
Everything was top tier. Food was excellent.

I stumbled across this place by chance. I don't eat steak/red meat but my girlfriend do.  So I wanted to take her to a steakhouse. Of course she ordered a steak abd I ordered the salmon dinner and let me tell you.  This was the best salmon I had. It just melted it my mouth and was flavored. My girlfriend stated that her steaj was so good, it was the second best strak she has had in her life. I'm definitely going back and I will upload pictures. But this is a must place to eat, worth every penny.
Dragon Fruit Margarita and The LongHorn Porterhouse..Perfect combination.. It was so delicious...

No complaints. Aury took great care of me, such a sweetie. Food was fresh and delicious. I also love the low key vibes in there, as the booths are high up to give privacy while dining. I'll definitely be back.
My favorite Steakhouse.
Evelina she is very good  thank you â˜ºï¸

The service and the food was off. This was my second time visiting this location and this time made me never want to go back again. I felt like I was at a local McDonald's because almost everything me and my date asked for they didn't have. I was seated without utensils and napkins So I asked for some. They never came with any so my date had to walk over to the bar and ask smh. My appetizers came out and I had to ask for appetizer plates. I couldn't get the iced tea I wanted. They ran out. They didn't have any of the long pour glasses for my margarita so they put it in a regular glass. The drink had no liquor. Sent it back. Got another drink. And had to pay for both. My food... my salmon was way overcooked. I couldn't eat it and my mash potatoes were cold. At this point I packed up paid and left

The food was good the steaks and burger came out med-rare instead of medium, it wasn't too bad but kids dont like to see too much blood! The dragon berry margaritas were good! Overall a decent experience.

Great service from Theresa! Food was phenomenal at a very reasonable price. My Gal and I had our fill of surf and turf, drinks for $129, with tip.
Highly recommend this place for lite fair as well as family  and friends.

TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!! The host told me 30 minutes. I patiently waited and an hour passed. People that came after me were seated before me. Once I was seated , I waited another 15 minutes and the waiter never came!!!! I had to wait for the waiter . Terrible terrible.

I went there on a Sunday afternoon I want to say like 3:00 I was told to wait for the hostess and shall I say it was the most unpleasant hostess I've ever experienced in my life she was very rude not inviting at all that I left and ended up eating at Olive garden

ê°€ê²©ëŒ€ë¹„ ê´œì°®ì€ ê°€ê²Œì˜€ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

Went there for Father's day and they were very short-staffed. I recommend joining the waitlist online. That helped us sit faster.  Our server was sweet even though she was so busy. I appreciate that. We ordered apps 1st and then the main. Everything came out in good timing. She first brought over some warm bread and butter and our drinks.
Food tasted great and the dessert was unexpectedly yummy.

A classic American steakhouse, spacious and comfortable. The bread before the meal was really good. The steak was a little over-charred, but nothing too serious, and the grilled corn that came with it was delicious. The lamb chops were decent too, though the brussels sprouts were definitely a bit too burnt. Despite a few small flaws, considering the price, theyâ€™ve done a great job overall. Plus, I ran into a really friendly server, which made the whole experience even better

Iâ€™ve been here 4-5x since I moved to Queens and it has never disappointed me. The service here is good - Iâ€™ve never had a negative experience. The servers are welcoming and always made me feel invited.

The cocktails here are pretty good and the prices are good too! As for the food, no complaints! I always order the rib eye and itâ€™s always cooked the way I like it â€˜medium rareâ€™. Their mashed potatoes are good and seasoned just right. My favorite is their mac and cheese, itâ€™s delicious and not overcooked.

I enjoy coming here and it has never disappointed.

Get the bread. They're running low and ask if you'd like some. It's worth it ğŸ˜

I've eaten at some of the best steakhouses in NYC so this was interesting to me as the cost was very cheap but the steak was pretty decent.

Only thing I'd say is that the consistency (medium rare for me) was very good but my sirloin was chewy. If there were no sides, I don't think i would have just enjoyed the steak.

I went here today 01/4/25 my server was named  Caroline she was nice and quickly attended to us I ordered a Ribeye Steak with mashed potatoes.
wait time for the food was average about 20-25 minutes the food then came and my steak was made perfectly and it tasted good. In general the service and food were great. And I will come here again in the future!!

Great atmosphere and friendly service! The steak was definitely good, and Iâ€™d recommend it. However, the Brussels sprouts were way too oily, practically dripping in oil. Also, the wine pairing could have been better. But overall, good food, great vibe, and excellent service.

This place has free refills which makes it 10/10 for services
Steak wise I got the longhorn and it was pretty good for its price
The only two thing I dinâ€™t like was the bake potatoes tasted stale but then again we went at night so I canâ€™t really judge for that, the steaks I recommend get it cook higher then what you prefer
Other then that
10/10 for every other categories
Which they had steak nachos

The food is amazing and ALWAYS taste the same ,, I start off with the mushroom appetizer itâ€™s soo yummy
The steak is cooked to perfection âœ¨
I always get a 6oz fillet it look very small but itâ€™s enough for me if you have big appetite I would say go for a 8oz or a different/ bigger steak ğŸ˜…

Food was great! Flavour was fantastic. However the service left much to be desired. Our server was kind and sweet, but it was impossible to get his attention. At one point our table was covered in empty cups and food plates but he never came around to clear them off. Instead one of his fellow servers had to clear it off for us. Even just paying for the meal was a hassle, it took ages to get his attention and longer still to get out the check. Please keep in mind while this was a saturday we went, the place was not packed. He never came around to offer help unless we got his attention first. As such, while the food was a pleasure, the service felt lacking depending on who your server is.

I thought it was great, classic Americana dinner spot with good food. Heavy meat with great seasoning. I recommended the outlaw ribeye. It's huge !!!

Great white peace sangria and food prices on beer ,

For 120$ including tip we got :
Ribeye with corn on the cob and mashed potatoes.
Outlaw ribeye with steakhouse Mac and cheese and brussel sprouts.( Steak came out a little more rare then medium rare but ehh whatever)
Wild West shrimp for the appetizer
White peach sangria and a Bud light.

Not bad at all!

Thanks guys for a great anniversary memory you helped us shape.......

I came here for dinner and I must say the staffs were really friendly,  food was tasty. Red rocks Grilled Shrimps and strawberry ğŸ“ peacan salad which were pretty good. This place that casual steakhouse for Grilled and other American dishes in ranch style space, that closed to Queen's Mall and Macy's Department in Queen. â¤ï¸ it.
This is our go to steakhouse beside that this is just .4 miles away from our place. The chicken wings with blue cheese dip is sooo good and the strawberry pecan salad. We always order rib eye.

Food excellent, environment excellent, excellent price, waiting to be attended by a waitress no good. If you are hungry, this not the place. If you not too hungry and patient then welcome. And I recommend you the cheeseburger with french fries.
Great service but food wasn't that good. Reasonable prices but the quality of the food let it down.

Decent food ! The steaks had lots of flavor and were good cuts of meat. Fatty and smoky beef with good sear. I got the ribeye. The fries and baked potato were good! However, the drinks were way too sweet and tasted artificial. The service was also poor - they took ages just to get our order and they werenâ€™t very friendly. We waited a good 10 mins just for them to collect our credit card after theyâ€™d given us the bill. Overall, a decent meal given the steak quality.

Food was ok. Steak didn't come out medium well at all. Came out more rare. Took almost 20 minutes after asking for a sprite to come in when bringing out the wrong drink. Was just alright. I'm usually a fan of longhorn but my neighborhood queens location here isn't well compared to others. Its .. OK. For the prices here I'd think it'll be much better service and kitchen bringing out the steak right. Ooo and the sweet potato my brother ordered.. came out burnt. Way too burnt and crispy. Dad's order also was wrong had to get it sent back. Thing that saved them for me was the wings and shrimp appetizer

The place is a great atmosphere. I noticed on the window they had a sanitary grade C posted. We decided to ignore it and  we went in with an open mind. Our waitress was so nice and kind. She took our order and brought us our drinks. The part that was upsetting was that we had to wait a half hour for our food. When our food came we noticed that my salmon was raw (as shown in the picture) I couldnâ€™t even eat it. It was absolutely disgusting. We had to wait a while to get the waiters attention. When we did she apologized and I understood it wasnâ€™t her fault.

Came here on a Monday evening. The restaurant is nice and spacious. Inside the restaurant is dim, gives off hunting lodge vibes. The host was very friendly. After shortly being seated, our server came over with our menu. Looking around, the floor was dirty, and the little light lamps by our table had a bunch of dust hanging. Definitely, this restaurant needs some cleaning done. On to the menu, there is a nice variety of foods to choose from for your main dish. For drinks, we ordered  a corona and a frozen strawberry margarita. Margarita was served in a big glass. Margarita was tasty and strong. For appetizers, we ordered the seasoned steak house wings, which is served with blue cheese dressing and a side of buffalo sauce. Wings were super flavorful on their own without the buffalo sauce. Wings were nice and crispy and seasoned very well. I loved the chunky blue cheese dressing. Now on to our main course. We ordered the 6 oz. Renegade Sirloin & 8 ct. Redrock Grilled Shrimp. That order comes with two side dishes, I ordered a side of Caesar salad and loaded baked potato. We ordered New York Strip* 12 oz with a side order of steakhouse mac & cheese and fire- grill corn on the cob. Caesar salad was good they put just the right amount of dressing on it. When my renegade sirloin meal came out, I  immediately saw they served my meal with the wrong side options. Instead of the loaded baked potato, it was served with a bunch of asparagus, seasoned rice pilaf, and a whole side bowl of crispy brussels sprouts. I told our server that it's not the side dishes I had ordered. He looked a bit confused and said, "No worries, it's on the house, and he would get me my loaded baked potato." Here's the thing that gets to me, just because a server says oh the incorrect food plated is on the house does not mean that the customer automatically is happy." Our server could have easily taken back my food and served it correctly. When you see a bunch of side dishes that you don't eat plated on your dish, you sort of lose your appetite.  I really did not get to enjoy this meal. Steak was tough and overcooked. It was well done instead of medium well as I requested, but then again, I was served someone else's food. The only thing I enjoyed were the shrimps. Now, onto my boyfriends meal, the New York Strip, the steak was more juicer, giving it's a better cut of the steak. I was not a fan of the mac and cheese. The corn was descent. It pains me to have to write reviews like this. I honestly was looking forward to enjoying my meal given that this was our first time ever at a LongHorn Steakhouse. But between the dirty floors, dusty light lamps and incorrect food served to us we were disappointed.
Great food . Good service. The hostess was a bit rude .

I went with my friends on 1/4/25 to this place they were fast to take us to our seat we got a holder for our drinks and they gave us bread with butter and then around 15 minutes we got our food got myself the chicken sandwich the food was very good I will recommend to anyone

The food is simply amazing, especially the outlaw ribeye and the mac & cheese. The drinks are top notch as well. Our waiter was the sweetest and attentive! Overall, my family and I enjoyed ourselves :)

Not a fan of chain steakhouses. There was no wait for a group of 4 on a Sunday evening which was surprisingly great. Ordered the outlaw ribeye. Lots of fat on it. Otherwise cooked well and tasty. No gravy for mashed potatoes, no bread. Soups are good. Overall, there are better options for price.

Hands down, the best steak Iâ€™ve had in a while! The flavors and tenderness were absolutely spot on, and you can tell the quality of the meat is top-notch. My partner swears by the ribeye and raves about it every time. As for me, I canâ€™t get enough of the steak saladâ€”itâ€™s a perfect blend of fresh and savory with a side of sweet potato that really completes the meal. A true â€œchefâ€™s kissâ€ finish for both of us. Highly recommend if youâ€™re looking for an unforgettable steak experience!

I have visited many longHorn Steakhouses. I can tell you menu same but food tasted differently.  I can honestly say their food was great!!.  Place was clean and airy.  For a Friday night 8p the waiting time was only 20 min for  9 people. I was amazed.   We had appetizers chicken wings which we asked light seasoning. It was good  not salty for us. Chicken bite was good and crispy. The wild wild shrimp was not crispy though on the soggy side.  The spinach dip great with the pita chips oh that was delicious.  Even my 3 yrs old grandson like the chips. I tried the lamb chop well done it was great it has a sweet taste sauce , tender. I was told itâ€™s there until May 1 on the menu . Iâ€™m not sorry for trying it.  All what we ordered was delicious . Restaurant is in the mall.

I go out to eat frequently and I don't think I've ever written a bad review in my life but this experience was genuinely intolerable. To get a full picture, my family of 4 went out to celebrate my birthday, I won't comment on the wait time bc i'm assuming they were short staffed so waiting wasn't a big issue to me. We all are busy individuals so we were ecstatic to spend time together (Therefore in great moods). We waited at the bar and ordered some drinks, bartender was friendly. When we got seated our server was Adrianna. She gave us menus and some time to look over them while my dad paid the bill at the bar. She comes back and as we start to order and the entire time it was an uncomfortable experience due to her blunt demeanor, cutting my brother off while he was trying to order his food (guess she wanted to start with drinks, then entree) perhaps she was in a rush, no problem. We brushed off her tone. When my dad asks for a salad she says "whats your entree" he replies with "what do you recommend?" She replies with "I can't tell you what to eat." Then he asks "Whats popular here?" She replies "Did you look at the menu?" & "I can come back" I interject and explain he just wants a recommendation of whats good. (I don't want to type the entire dialogue but it didn't get much better.) Anyways, I wish I could convey the tone in which she spoke to my family. Shortly after the interaction all of our moods were ruined so we just decided to tell them we'll take our orders to go, pay the bill, and leave. Also when I asked another waiter helping us if I could have some steak sauce to go he said they didn't have that, so I asked if I could get some steak sauce in a to go container instead, which he replied "I'll see what I can do" What kind of steak house doesn't have some steak sauce? What a poor representation of this establishment overall and what a terrible experience of service. Will not be returning. Wish I could get back my limited family time, and $190 wasted. We still tipped because maybe she was having an off day. Hope someone working there sees this and they're able to reflect on the service they provide because to upset my entire family on my birthday and have me sitting here writing this long review should speak volume. Thanks.

Great Customer service and food.

Lamp chops (med) were delicious and were cooked perfectly. Cheesy mushrooms were fresh and had an explosive flavor along with the mash potatoes. Portions are generous and wait times are favorable.

Overall a great steakhouse option with classic dishes and good service. Decor is a bit dated.
The food was good Iâ€™ve been here many times but sometimes they do over cook my steak. They are understaffed too because I wait for a long time just for napkins or a refill on a drink.

Staff is friendly and helpful. The lunch menu is amazing! They have a few options for $11 which I think itâ€™s a great price! And the food was delicious I had the chicken salad with lobster soup and my friend had the steak salad with french onion soup!

Came in around 3pm on a Monday with my partner. It was our first time dining in so we were very excited to experience Longhorn.

We had a sweet waitress by the name of Rosa, she did a magnificent job. Very warm energy and patient when explaining the menu and reading back our orders. She even didnâ€™t have any issue helping me use the gift cards I had for the meal. Just for the service alone, I would be back.

Now letâ€™s get into the meat and potatoes ğŸ˜‚
The bread is delicious! They serve it with a whipped butter. My wife and I decided to go with the seasoned wings for an appetizer. Great choice! It came with an selection of sauces. Big beautiful wings & fried to perfection. My wife likes them a lot! I felt they were more on the saltier side but I think sugar is salty so ignore my tastebuds lol.

We both decided to get a sirloin cut and man, we werenâ€™t disappointed! Smooth and buttery!! I had mines medium well as my wife had hers medium. She had the sweet potato, I chose the crispy Brussels sprouts. We went to townnn!!
